Seajax v2 Unit Test Help Page

This here is only bare-bones information. More to follow.

Introduction

Test path is [suite-name]_[test-name]

Configuration

Execution and reporting of unit tests is somewhat configurable via the test page url. Configuration parameters are provided as url parameters.

filter

This setting is a regex expression that is matched against each test's path, which consists of its suite name followed by and underscore followed by the specific test's name. For matches, the specific test is run; otherwise, the specific test is not run. The default filter is empty.

priority

Suites and or tests are assigned to a priority level. The default level is zero. Specifying this configuration setting allows running of tests with priority greater than zero. For a specified priority level N here, all tests with assigned priority less than or equal to N are run.

tags

Tags provide another angle for selecting subsets of tests. Suites and tests can be assigned a tag. By selecting one or more tags in the configuration setting (separated by comma), only those tests that have one of these tags are run.

reportTo

By default, test results are displayed visually on the unit test page. This setting allows for reporting the results to some service. If provided, the value must be an absolute http url path. The test results, in JSON format, will be POSTed to this url once all tests complete.

Running Tests

Selected tests can be re-run simply by refreshing the page.
